description: Cashier amount ($8,320.00) rounded down from PSP amount ($8,320.50). Difference: $0.50. ERP synced from PSP feed and matches original.

cashierValue.description: Amount rounded down during manual entry

erpValue.description: Synced from PSP feed — original amount

suggestedResolution: Manual rounding error in cashier system. Update cashier amount to $8,320.50 to match PSP and ERP. Review cashier manual entry process to prevent future rounding.

description: Significant amount mismatch: PSP ($5,200.00) vs Cashier ($5,500.00). Difference: $300.00. Cashier may have included processing fee in recorded amount.

pspValue.description: Wire transfer received from client account

cashierValue.description: Cashier recorded with processing fee included

erpValue.description: ERP entry matches PSP net amount

suggestedResolution: Cashier recorded gross + fee ($5,500) instead of gross only ($5,200). Verify with cashier team whether $300 is the processing fee. Adjust cashier entry to $5,200.00 and move fee to separate field.

description: Cashier record missing for TXN-2024-004. PSP ($3,150.75) and ERP ($3,150.75) match, but no corresponding entry found in cashier system. Sync timeout detected.

erpValue.description: Debit posted from PSP API sync

suggestedResolution: Network timeout during cashier sync. Auto-retry scheduled in 5 minutes. If retry fails, manually create cashier entry from PSP source data. Escalate to IT if sync timeouts persist.

description: ERP includes $0.75 processing fee not reflected in PSP or Cashier amounts. PSP and Cashier agree at $7,250.25, ERP shows $7,251.00.
suggestedResolution: ERP added $0.75 gateway fee automatically. This matches the PSP fee schedule for crypto conversions. Auto-adjustment recommended — mark as reconciled with fee note.

description: ERP record missing for TXN-2024-007. PSP ($2,100.00) and Cashier ($2,100.00) match, but no ERP entry found. API timeout during sync.
suggestedResolution: ERP API timeout on first sync attempt. Auto-retry scheduled. If retry succeeds, mark as reconciled. If not, manually post ERP debit entry from PSP/Cashier source data.

description: FX rate difference: PSP/Cashier used settlement rate ($4,500.00), ERP booked at different rate ($4,480.00). Differential: 0.44% ($20.00).

pspValue.description: FX conversion — USD to EUR deposit

erpValue.description: ERP booked at different FX rate (0.44% diff)

suggestedResolution: FX rate moved between settlement time (1.0842) and ERP booking time (1.0794). Variance is within 1% tolerance band. Review FX booking policy — consider using settlement rate consistently.

description: ERP posted next-day settlement value ($9,720.00) instead of same-day value ($9,750.00). PSP and Cashier agree at $9,750.00. Timing-related amount drift.
suggestedResolution: ERP batch runs on T+1, causing settlement value to differ by $30.00 due to end-of-day adjustments. Confirm with ERP team whether posting schedule can be moved to T+0.

description: ERP deducted $1.50 gateway fee from posted amount. PSP and Cashier show $1,450.00, ERP shows $1,448.50.
suggestedResolution: ERP auto-deducted gateway fee from posted amount. Fee matches ERP fee ledger ($1.50 for Skrill e-wallet). Auto-adjustment recommended — mark as reconciled with fee note.

description: Significant FX rate variance: PSP/Cashier used spot rate ($3,800.00), ERP used closing rate ($3,760.00). Differential: 1.05% ($40.00).

pspValue.description: FX deposit — GBP to USD conversion

suggestedResolution: FX variance exceeds 1% tolerance. ERP used end-of-day closing rate instead of spot rate. Escalate to treasury team for review. Consider policy change to standardize FX rate source across systems.

description: Cashier record missing for TXN-2024-015. PSP ($11,200.00) and ERP ($11,200.00) match, but cashier system was offline during transaction window.
suggestedResolution: Cashier system was offline at time of transaction. High-value transaction ($11,200) requires manual verification. Create cashier entry from PSP source data and escalate to finance team for approval.

description: Cashier recorded $20 handling fee in amount. PSP ($14,500.00) and ERP ($14,500.00) agree, Cashier shows $14,520.00.
suggestedResolution: Cashier included $20 handling fee in the transaction amount instead of recording it separately. Adjust cashier entry to $14,500.00 and move $20 to fee field.
